title: TO_DATE
description: Converts a given value into a Date. Acceptable inputs include strings representing dates, datetime values. If the input cannot be converted, the function returns an error.

parameters.name: string/datetime
parameters.description: The value to convert to a Date.

examples:
TO_DATE("2005-11-15")
-- Returns November 15, 2005 as a date value

TO_DATE(NOW())
-- Returns today's date by extracting the date portion from the current datetime.

IF(TO_DATE(Invoice_Date__c) < TODAY(), "Overdue", "Upcoming")
-- Converts the text field 'Invoice_Date__c' into a Date value and compares it with today's date
-- If the invoice date is earlier than today, the formula returns "Overdue"; otherwise, it returns "Upcoming".

tips.text: Returns null immediately for blank or null inputs.
If primary parsing fails, attempts parsing via JSON deserialization.
As a final attempt, replaces dashes (-) with slashes (/) and retries parsing.
Throws an ApplicationException if all parsing attempts fail.
